parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From eklegomai; select; by implication, favorite.
(held precious, hence) precious, honored, honorable in rank. From en and time; valued.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
